metadata.feature_description: View and track which content items (pages, files) are using specific workflows.

steps.expected: Workflows page should display with list of available workflows
steps.actual: Workflows page displayed with list of workflows including Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, Test Approval Workflow, etc.

steps.action: Click on 'View Usage' link for Direct Publish workflow
steps.expected: Dialog should open showing resources using the workflow
steps.actual: Workflow Usage Information dialog opened showing list of resources with NAME and CONTENT TYPE columns

steps.action: View resources for Direct Publish workflow which has 20 resources
steps.expected: Resources should be displayed with pagination if more than 20 exist
steps.actual: 20 resources displayed. No 'Load More' button visible - either all resources fit within the page limit or there are exactly 20 resources. The API supports pagination with ResourcesSteps=20 per the code.

issues: Could not fully test pagination as no 'Load More' button was visible. The code supports pagination (20 items per page) but either all resources fit within the limit or the UI doesn't display pagination controls when there are exactly 20 items.

steps.action: Count resources displayed for Direct Publish workflow
steps.expected: Resource count should match actual resources using the workflow
steps.actual: 20 folder resources displayed for Direct Publish workflow

steps.action: Count resources displayed for Test Approval Workflow
steps.expected: Resource count should match actual resources using the workflow
steps.actual: 20 page resources displayed for Test Approval Workflow

steps.action: View resources for Direct Publish workflow
steps.expected: CONTENT TYPE column should show appropriate resource types
steps.actual: All resources showed 'Folder' as content type - these are folder assets using the Direct Publish workflow

steps.action: View resources for Test Approval Workflow
steps.expected: CONTENT TYPE column should show appropriate resource types
steps.actual: All resources showed 'Page' as content type - these are pages using the Test Approval Workflow

steps.action: View resource titles for Direct Publish workflow
steps.expected: NAME column should show correct folder paths

steps.action: View resource titles for Test Approval Workflow
steps.expected: NAME column should show correct page paths

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test empty resource list for unused workflow

steps.action: View resources for Save Draft workflow (which has no resources)
steps.expected: Dialog should show empty list with just headers
steps.actual: Workflow Usage Information dialog opened showing empty list with NAME and CONTENT TYPE headers but no resources

observations: Workflows not currently in use do not display a 'View Usage' link - this is by design since there are no resources to show

The API returns resources with pagination support (20 items per page via ResourcesSteps constant), but the 'Load More' button was not visible during testing - either all resources fit within the limit or the UI has specific conditions for showing pagination
Two content types were observed: 'Folder' for asset folders and 'Page' for pages - matching the code which returns ContentType from GetWorkflowUsage
Resource paths use different formats: folders use single-slash paths (/Images/), pages use double-slash paths (//BulkTestPage1)
